name: fastk
description: K-mer counter for high-fidelity shotgun datasets

repo.name: FASTK
repo.description: A fast K-mer counter for high-fidelity shotgun datasets

readme.summary: The documentation is detailed and comprehensive, but lacks clear installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.

injection_risks.description: The function hopen() is used to open a file, but it does not seem to be vulnerable to injection attacks as the filename comes from a trusted source (hts_idx_getfn()). However, if an attacker can manipulate the input to hts_idx_getfn(), they may be able to inject malicious filenames.

The function zlib_mem_inflate() is used to decompress data, but it does not seem to be vulnerable to injection attacks as the input comes from a trusted source (the index file). However, if an attacker can manipulate the input to zlib_mem_inflate(), they may be able to inject malicious data.

critical_findings: Potential injection risk in the hopen() function
Lack of input validation in the cram_index_load() function
security.summary: The code has some potential security issues, including a low-risk injection vulnerability and lack of input validation, but overall it appears to be relatively secure.

common_complaints: how to convert FastK *.hist to a text file
Merged libraries do not show lower-count k-mers
praise_themes: brew install fastk is now available in Homebrew Core
sentiment.summary: The community health appears neutral with moderate frustration due to unresolved issues and lack of maintainer responsiveness, but there are some positive contributions like the availability in Homebrew.

red_flags: Occasional dismissive tone towards new contributors
communication.summary: The maintainer is generally helpful and clear, but occasionally shows a dismissive attitude towards new contributors.

concerns: Low number of commits in the past six months (only 1)
No merged PRs in the past six months
positive_signals: Open issues and PRs indicate some level of community interest or need
maintenance.summary: The package shows minimal maintenance with recent activity but low commit frequency.
